keyword: how many calories are in a stick of butter
title: How Many Calories Are in a Stick of Butter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a stick of butter—about 810 kcal—plus full nutrition breakdown, fat content, and easy tweaks for lighter options.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Stick of Butter?
assumptions: Standard US stick (1/2 cup, 113 g), unsalted, regular butter at room temperature.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, salted vs. unsalted, fat content, and exact weight. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard stick of butter packs about 810 calories, primarily from saturated fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to light butter (reduced fat version)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 kcal for a standard 113 g stick.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: About 92 g total fat, including 58 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does salted butter have more calories than unsalted?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same; only sodium increases slightly.

faqs.q: How many tablespoons in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: 8 tablespoons, with about 100 kcal per tablespoon.
Yes, light or whipped butter can reduce calories by 200–300 per stick.
